chargeHist.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit
Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher D. Zindars was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).
  • Fraudulent Claim/Income Tax Credit, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 71.83(2)(b)4.
  • Fraudulent Claim/Income Tax Credit, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 71.83(2)(b)4.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with Count 6 & 7 BUT Consecutive to any existing sentence, including but not limited to 15CF47 & 15CF120.

superMiscConds.notes: Court orders restitution to be made in increments of no less than $200.00 per month beginning on the first day of the month, 60 days after the defendant's release from incarceration.    In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
**Court dismisses and reads-in any uncharged referrals for any false publis assistance claims & any false income tax filings during 2012, 2013, & 2014 and any potential drug charges from the search warrant executed in March & November 2015.**
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

records.addlTxt: Transcript of Plea & Sentencig Hearing - December 28, 2016

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 2:02 pm case called. Defendant Christopher D. Zindars in court with attorney Jonathan Thomas Groh.  Defendant Christopher D. Zindars in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on record-argued sentence.   Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1, No Contest to Count 6, & No Contest to Count 7.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 2, 3, 4, & 5 and any uncharged referrals for any false public assistance claims, any false income tax filings during 2012, 2013, & 2014, and any potential drug charges from the search warrant executed in March & November 2015. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Groh. Statement by defendant. Court makes statement prior to sentencing. Court sentences the defendant to on Each Count-4 years Wisconsin State Prison to be served as 2 years Initial Confinement and 2 years Extended Supervision. Concurrent to each other but consecutive to any existing sentence including but not limited to 15CF47 & 15CF120. CONDITIONS of ES: Restitution of $5,927.00 to be paid in increments of no less than $200 per month beginning on the first day of the month 60 days from release from incarceration.  AODA and follow through, Absolute sobriety, No bars, no imparing substances without a valid prescription. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan.   DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Court does finds defendant eligible for CIP and SAP. Appeal Rights Given.

Case called @ 11:22 a.m. Defendant Christopher D. Zindars in court with attorney William Michael Lennon. Defendant appears via video from New Lisbon Correctional. Attorney Lennon appears telephonically.  Scott Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion for withdrawal of counsel filed by Atty Lennon. Statement by DE regarding request to have Atty Lennon withdraw. The Court will permit Atty Lennon to withdraw. The Court is unsure if SPD will appoint another attorney as the defendant has previously had two SPD appointed attorneys on this case.  Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2016 at 08:45 am.

Case Called @ 2:57 PM: Defendant Christopher D. Zindars in court with attorney Melinda R Alfredson-Clausen.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Alfredson-Clausen - counsel requests to withdraw from this case.  Statement by Def as to withdrawal request - joins in request.  Def wishes subsequent counsel be appointed.  Def advised that the next attorney will more than likely be the last opportunity thru SPD office.  If issues arise with the next counsel, SPD more than likely will not appoint another counsel.  Court will permit withdrawal and Atty Alfredson-Clausen to submit order on withdrawal.  STC Scheduled.  Status conference scheduled for August 2, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Case Called @ 1:03 PM:  Defendant Christopher D. Zindars in court, in custody, appears via video.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. Advised of right to counsel - Def wants counsel and has not yet spoken with SPD.  Def referred to SPD for eligibility.  DA argues as to bond order.  Notes for the record that Atty Zamzow is representing Def on pending cases.  Requests Signature Bond w/conditions.  No statement by Defendant  as to bond.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
